I'm going to apologize in advance for the whiny selfish nature of this post...especially since its been a long time since I've posted to begin with

So...because of numerous threats of bodily harm to update my journal...here I am...amazing what can happen in a few months...
Last time most people heard from me before I dropped off the face of the earth Corey had moved up from California to be with me, there was an engagement ahhhh well, the best laid plans. So much for that. Although Corey had a job when he moved up here after a few weeks he started getting less and less hours and eventually they just stopped calling. He gets laid off and in the process his self confidence is shot to hell. Poor guy. For many of you who do not know Core, hes the greatest guy in the world but very much a glass is half empty type person. Just who he is. Anyway...after a month or so of half assed job searching, he springs on me that he is unhappy in Eugene for various reasons and wants to break up and move back to California. 

I flip, quite naturally. Considering nothing is wrong with US as a couple so why fix something that isn't broken so to speak.  We make a compromise that he gives it some more time and we'll talk about it then...so a month passes and he gets a good paying job that he ends up hating because his boss is a gambling addict with a bit of a bad attitude towards just about everything, mostly the female species among other things. Anyway...he quits his job and decides to go back to California for some time to clear his head about being engaged and just being in a relationship in general, and whether he wants to move back in a few months. I eventually agree after much discussion that its better he give it a try than staying in Eugene and possibly resenting me for being tied to a life that he doesn't want. So...Wednesday he packs his stuff up and we make the grueling 8 hour drive back to Wheatland, CA, with me bawling the last two hours of the drive...I drop him at his parents house, make him go inside because I simply can't drive off with him standing there...manage to drive myself to the pay phone around the corner and call my dad. Which was a life saver..I eventually got myself under control after a half an hour and drive the 11 hours back to Beaverton overnight. Not fun.  

Thursday morning, after rolling into town at 6:30 in the morning,  when I wake up  in my childhood bedroom, with my golden retriever sleeping on my legs and a cat wrapped around my neck, I stumble to check my email where I have a wrenching note from Corey only a few hours I left saying he feels sick about his decision not sure he made the correct choice in going back there even temporarily. That it doesn't feel right being there, he's confused, and will most likely be coming back to Eugene shortly etc etc. My first reaction to this is anger, after driving for almost 20 hours, going through the worst emotional experience of my life, only for him to change his mind four hours after I leave. I hadn't even gotten out of California when he has this epiphany. Frankly I'm just grouchy and feeling a little used and extremely abandoned. However...after a year and a half of speaking with him everyday for several hours a day...I'm not cut off completely from speaking with him other than a few quick instant messages. I feel like a junkie going through withdrawls. How sad...I've essentially forgotten how to simply be alone.  He decided while he was here and speaking with his friends back home that they would make a trip to Reno since he missed his friends birthday trip to Reno...he left tonight...barely 48 hours after I left him in California. Strke two...hes partying with friends while I'm sitting in my apartment lonely with no one to talk to but myself. Not a real healthy habit, although I indulge myself from time to time. 

So here I sit...after work I rented a few movies that Corey would never like and return home having to pee really badly realizing I've locked myself out of my apartment. Fantastic...so I drive to a phone and interrupt my landlords Peaknuckle game, assuming thats how you spell it. Get a key return home and wander around the apartment in my underwear eating lemon sorbet and pacing. Phone rings..my roomate James is moving the rest of his stuff in tonight..and the movie I'm watching can't keep my interest mainly because is has subtitles that are distracting me when I can understand half of the German they are speaking. Bleh...

Anyway...I'll quit whining now and most likely feed my fish and go to bed...such an eventful friday night...pout..would really like to get out of the house but have a complete lack of someplace to go...pout again...

Goodnight world...pout

Wow what a slacker I've been lately...well at least on the LJ front
Been an absolutely insane past few weeks...have hit a really rough patch with my dad of all people he has quite the list of issues involving me moving out...and made me feel irresponsible, selfish and slutty all in one conversation. Gotta love parents, fortunately enough my mom and extended family are being as sweet as humanly possible. Especially after weeks and months of crappiness between jobs, and apartments things finally started to fall into place. I got a job at a retirement facitiity as a waitress, we were approved for an fairly nice and inexpensive apartment with a very cool landlord ( he says we can paint the place any way we want so long as its back to white when we move out) Anyone want to help me with some murals :) We'll see though...but got my new phone number taken care of etc, and just have electricity deposit to do and all is done and I can move in on the 10th of June!!!!!!!!! Weeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee...anybody who wants my new information (address and phone etc) just need to ask. Have to figure out some way to transfer my stuff from here to there with no car...hmmm. We shall see. 
But other than that Corey was here for a few interview and had the week from hell last week, where everything was due on the same day and I seriously considered moving to Mongolia, possibly Tibet. My cousin Matt the shining star of the family made it home from Iraq two days ago...I watched his air craft carrier come into San Diego all on video phone and admitedly cried like a baby. So glad to have him back...don't tell the others but he's my favorite. He and his fiance are thinking about getting married sometime in the spring, which made me think about creative ways to tell my parents corey and I are engaged. Oh yeah...this should be interesting. Any ideas anyone?

Guess its the Feng shui instinct in everyone. Definitely has some good vibes. And I love places that just have that good energy...kinda like Carol and georges place. But anyway...I'm going to make amends with my boyfriend after being a teary headcase the past few days and hope he hasn't changed his mind about marrying me ;)

Okay...so I'm in a bit of a ranting mood after what I saw this afternoon...on with the soapbox
So...on my home from bombing my calculus exam regardless of countless of hours of studying, anyway... I am still in a good mood because the sun is out and I'm trying to keep a positive attitude regardless of what just happened. And I see the back of a man holding up a huge sign, guessing that it was simply another religious group on campus I payed no mind until...I look down at a sign that says: "Warning graphic pictures ahead" and as I glace up I am face to face with a 8 feet tall color poster of an aborted babies head, or rather what is left of it. I consider myself to have a stomach of iron and can take on situations that would make most people gag. But I could feel my stomach doing somersaults when I saw this. Not from the actual image, although completely grotesque but for the absolute audacity these people have to use shock value and horrific pictures to get across their opinions, when there are so many better ways to do this. Without making half of the university turn green. Among their extremely bad taste they, this just pounds home the point that these people are completely out of their minds. They also had posters of victims from the Holocaust, calling the "Abortion Revolution" "Americas Holocaust" and comparing clinic doctors to Hitler. I don't have to tell anyone that Hitler and his regime were a group of meglomaniacs. I'm from almost entirely German descent and lived in Germany for 3 years of my life. I even have members of my family who were members of the Gestapo, and inheireted a box of Nazi memorabilia from a great uncle who I never knew. The box now sits in a storage facility until I decide what to do with it. But anyway...my point...Hitlers annihalted over seven million innocents based on religious beliefs. The idea that these protestors or demostraters, whichever they want to be called, should probably brush up on their history and the reasons behind it before they start making comparisons like that. 
And...another thing, I'm a firm believer in people exercising their right to freedom of expression, even when I think they are crazier than bedbugs. However, I don't think anyone should be forced to listen or view thier opinions if they do not want to. And with how this was set up there is virtually no way any student can walk to class without walking past these half a dozen or so 8 by 6 posters. So unless you closed your eyes and prayed that your feet would guide you to class without getting hit by a car you had no choice but to look at these displays. That is simply unfair, no one should have to look at this unless they choose to, I've seen pictures from abortions and have even gone with friends to recieve abortions because of medical reasons. And I agree wholeheartedly that it is not a pleasant process, the noises smells and sights are forever burned into my mind. Yet, even being right in the front lines, walking through protestors at abortion clinics to hold friends hands as they went through this process, I still remain a firm believer in pro choice. I'm all for people having children when they are ready, I plan to have a few rug rats of my own one of these days, and I also support women faced with the decision for personal, medical or religious convictions. You have my full hearted respect and blessing  with any decision made regardless of whether or not I agree with you.  So I guess my point in saying that is screw you people you're not going to change my mind, if anything you solidified my belief system that much more...so thanks for that.  
Also...one of the signs other than the aborted child, holocaust and baby killer posters also bothered me...It had once again a picture of an aborted baby with the caption "God Bless America?" I have never been in my life a patriotic person, I have a laundry list of things I think are wrong with this place, but I have a even longer list of why this is the best damned place in the world to live. Because only in America can crazy fucks like you do sick things like this legally, and only here can I tell you I'll see you in hell when you waive your pamphlets in my face and call me a baby killer. But sadly you forgot on top of a baby killer I'm also a tree hugging, dirt worshipping, cute fuzzy bunny petting liberal 19 year old who is only disgusted by your displays of ignorance and desperation, and not altered in any way than to really feel sorry for you. So that is all you get..my disgust and pity.
And lastly...to the woman who had her 8 year old son holding one of these god awful signs, and tried to hand me a pamphlet on anti abortion, when I politely refused with a "no thank you" you called me a "baby killer" do not think that I didn't hear you as I breezed past, but I tell you now, that I hope you heard my response of "facist bitch" flung back at you. I believe the only reason I didn't engage myself if a full blown altercation was one, the presence of the police and my complete lack of desire to waste my precious time on someone with such a narrowminded view of the world. Also...I don't feel the need to make an ass of myself in public by arguing with you, you're already making an ass of yourself enough for a dozen people. And don't you dare try and make me or anyone else feel guilty for any decisions they make in their life. I think you've already proved to approximately ten thousand people today that you don't deserve an iota of respect for showing pictures of someones aborted baby. That used to be someone's child for god sakes, and this demostration using these pictures is, simply put, a disgusting act of disrespect. And for that, makes you morally devoid, horrible excuse for a forgiving and gracious human being. 

Alright...just had to get that off my chest before I exploded with pure rage....sorry if I offended someone in this process, I'm not irritated about their protests..they have every right to voice their opinions. But the manner in which it was presented is absolutely horrific and disrespecful to all who are forced to view it.
You can send me your opinions if you wish...positive, negative, indifferent...I'll get down off my soapbox now...its been a fun ride.
